column6: Although no records of toxicity have been seen for this species, a number of other members of this genus are said to be toxic and so some caution is advised.
column7: Cool woods from Newfoundland to Ontario and southwards.
column8: N. America - Newfoundland to British Columbia, south to South Carolina, Iowa and Tennessee.
column16: Lycopodium lucidulum is a FERN growing to 0.2 m (0ft 8in).  See above for USDA hardiness. It is hardy to UK zone 5.  Suitable for: light (sandy) and medium (loamy) soils and prefers  well-drained soil. Suitable pH: mildly acid, neutral and basic (mildly alkaline) soils. It can grow in full shade (deep woodland) or  semi-shade (light woodland). It prefers  moist soil.
column18: Woodland Garden Dappled Shade; Shady Edge; not Deep Shade;
column23: Plants For A Future can not take any responsibility for any adverse effects from the use of plants. Always seek advice from a professional before using a plant medicinally.None known
column24: Mordant: Used for making a dye more permanent, it also affects the colour of the dye.
column25: The plant can be used as a mordant in dyeing[172].
column27: Thrives in a rough spongy peat in a shady position[1]. Requires a humid atmosphere[200]. Terrestrial members of this genus are hard to establish. The roots are delicate and liable to rot, most water being absorbed through the foliage[200]. Members of this genus are rarely if ever troubled by browsing deer[233]. Although looking more like a moss, this genus is closely related to the ferns[200].
column28: Spores - best sown as soon as they are ripe on the surface of a humus-rich sterilized soil. Keep the compost moist, preferably by putting a plastic bag over the pot. Pot on small clumps of plantlets as soon as they are large enough to handle and keep humid until they are well established. Do not plant outside until the ferns are at least 2 years old and then only in a very well sheltered position. The spores are generally produced in abundance but are difficult to grow successfully[200]. Layering of growing tips[200].
